alert.note: Alert for Jefferson; Scott (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 25 at 5:51AM EDT until March 25 at 6:37PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Louisville KY has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Indiana... Muscatatuck River near Deputy affecting Scott and Jefferson Counties. .Heavy rain from the past 36 hours will cause the river to rise. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING TO THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Muscatatuck River near Deputy. * WHEN...From early this morning to this evening. * IMPACTS...At 25.0 feet, County roads are underwater. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:30 AM EDT Saturday the stage was 25.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 26.0 feet this morning. It will then fall below flood stage this afternoon. - Flood stage is 25.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 25.7 feet on 09/09/2018. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Stay tuned to NOAA Weather Radio and your local media for the latest information. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lmk. The next statement will be issued later this morning.
